image.altText: A woman with cropped blonde hair, standing outside the courthouse.

props.synopsis: The woman who assaulted a former Northern Territory chief minister with a cream crepe has been sentenced to 12 months imprisonment, fully suspended.

title.children: Woman behind crepe attack on NT chief minister sentenced in court

image.altText: A helicopter in a cloudy sky, framed by the top branches of green trees.

props.synopsis: Police have conducted a large-scale search-and-rescue operation in Darwin's East Point Reserve on Tuesday, after phone triangulation revealed it to be the last known location of a man missing for 10 days.

title.children: Last ping of missing man's phone sparks large-scale police search in Darwin

image.altText: close-up of guns lying on a table.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says it does not support the Commonwealth's proposed national gun buyback scheme, stating the territory should not have to share the cost 50:50.

title.children: NT rejects national gun buyback scheme over co-funding proposal

image.altText: A woman in a green top with pandanus trees in the background

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic violence commissioner and local legal services have raised concerns about women's safety at Katherine Local Court, saying urgent upgrades are needed to protect victim-survivors.

title.children: Women forced to discuss DV cases in public at 'unsafe' outback court

image.altText: A woman laying in bed wearing a blue medical suit.

props.synopsis: Women with lipoedema in the Northern Territory are struggling to access the care they need, forcing some to relocate for specialist treatment. The condition, often misunderstood, requires better medical support in regional Australia.

title.children: People with lipoedema face healthcare barriers, forcing some to relocate

image.altText: Beakers water contamination

props.synopsis: The tap water in the Northern Territory town of Katherine — which includes a "designer" mix of river water from the world-famous Nitmiluk National Park and mineral-rich groundwater — has been named Australia's best drop.

title.children: PFAS to perfection: The story behind regional NT town's 'designer' water

image.altText: An old photograph of a young girl

props.synopsis: As police up the reward to $1 million for information that will lead to the remains of missing school girl Eloise Worledge, questions remain about why police disregarded a known rapist in their investigation.

title.children: The man cops overlooked in Eloise Worledge disappearance

image.altText: man with moustache and beard, sunglasses, and baseball cap wears a beige short sleeve shirt stands in front of a white truck

props.synopsis: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

title.children: Indian truckies fed up with racist tirades over their CB radios

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Venezuela is in the hands of both Donald Trump and a regime loyal to its ousted leader. The country's future, including the well-being of its people, is likely to depend on how well Delcy Rodríguez can walk a tightrope between Washington's demands and her coalition's hardliners.

title.children: Trump says he's in control in Venezuela but these experts say it won't last

image.altText: An aerial photo showing land burnt and land not burnt

props.synopsis: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

title.children: Victoria's bushfires more than five times the size of Singapore

image.altText: a woman with red hair hugging her children

props.synopsis: From second-hand uniform shops, saving plans and making tough decisions, here's what some families are doing to keep the costs associated with education down.

title.children: It costs Kate $2,400 to send her kids to public school. Here's how she saves

image.altText: A shot from below of a climber near the top of a rock cliff with a rope trailing below.

props.synopsis: A 31-year-old French national was climbing with a friend at Buckland in Tasmania's south-east when he fell from a cliff. He later died in hospital.

title.children: Breaking: Rock climber dies in 20m fall from Tasmanian cliff

image.altText: Two military vehicles drive through woodland. A soldier is stationed on top of the one in front.

props.synopsis: Analysts say Russia's new Oreshnik hypersonic missile will continues to pose challenges for NATO after Moscow used the weapon for a second time in Ukraine.

title.children: Russia's 'unstoppable' nuclear-capable missile sparks emergency UN meeting

image.altText: Jerome Powell, US Federal Reserve Chair

props.synopsis: Lisa Cook vs the US federal government will hit the courts next week. The case comes as Australia's Reserve Bank governor, Michele Bullock, signs a letter in support of US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is facing a criminal investigation in the United States.

title.children: Global monetary system to face major test next week

image.altText: Bondi Beach bridge three weeks after terrorist attack.

props.synopsis: The Bondi Beach footbridge that some locals want removed following last month's terror attack was already going to need replacement for structural reasons, it can be revealed.

title.children: Gunmen used this Bondi Beach footbridge. What should be done with it now?

image.altText: Two people in high-vis look at a bridge.

props.synopsis: Families in the central Queensland community of Clermont describe the moment they escaped swiftly rising floodwaters triggered by ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

title.children: Survival tales from flood-hit Clermont as ex-TC Koji recovery begins

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and suit smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal a neurosurgeon specialising in spinal surgery is among five people facing serious charges over a Queensland scheme allegedly involving kickbacks for medical devices.

title.children: Brisbane neurosurgeon charged over alleged medical devices kickback scheme

image.altText: Young man placing a transparent plastic container of food into the microwave.

props.synopsis: Researchers say there are some simple ways to help minimise our exposure to the microplastics and nanoplastics in our homes.

title.children: Air-drying laundry, wooden chopping boards: Reducing exposure to microplastics at home

image.altText: Bill and Hillary Clinton standing side-by-side in the US Capitol.

props.synopsis: Republicans in the US House say they could commence contempt of Congress proceedings against the former president and former Democratic presidential nominee.

title.children: Clintons refuse to testify for US House Epstein investigation

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone while holding up his hand.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has risen despite Wall Street's retreat from its record highs, while global central bank chiefs, including RBA governor Michele Bullock, issue a joint statement in support of US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is under criminal investigation. Follow live.

title.children: Trump unleashes again on 'that jerk' Powell, ASX opens higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump unleashes again on 'that jerk' Powell
Gold and silver scale new heights as uncertainty and US rate cuts loom

image.altText: Man stands at the end of boardwalk lookout on a mountain with city lights in background.

props.synopsis: Loved by bushwalkers and tourists, a sacred Aboriginal site, and with weather conditions that can quickly deteriorate, Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington is a challenge to manage — and a government review of how that is done is being met with concerns.

title.children: Sharp rebuke over 'strange' review of mountain management

image.altText: Middle-aged woman with red hair and a blue dress, boab tree on the background

props.synopsis: Kimberley artist Jeanne Barnes is one of the few people — an estimated one in nine million — who have been hit by lightning not once, but twice.

title.children: Lightning-strike survivor hit twice in six years during dial-up phone calls

image.altText: Tennis player Stefanos Tsitsipas throws his head back during a match.

props.synopsis: Australians Aleksandar Vukic and Rinky Hijikata join Thanasi Kokkinakis in the men's last 16 in Adelaide, while Stefanos Tstisipas slide continues.

title.children: Aussies roar in Adelaide as former Aus Open finalist continues slide

image.altText: Alex de Minaur celebrating in court

props.synopsis: With the 2026 Australian Open just around the corner here's everything you need to know about the tournament.

title.children: Australian Open 2026: When the tournament starts and the stars to watch

image.altText: a groupd of about sixty people from the National Socialist Network dressed in black at a rally outside parliament house sydney

props.synopsis: In a statement posted to Telegram, the group announced the closure of the National Socialist Network would also spell the end of "co-projects" White Australia, the European Australian Movement and the White Australia Party.

title.children: 'We don't want them': Neo-Nazi group says it will disband ahead of new laws

image.altText: A portrait of Craig Silvey, 43, with short brown hair and stubble, smiling brightly with his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most renowned authors, Craig Silvey, faces court after he allegedly distributed child exploitation material.

title.children: Author Craig Silvey not cooperating with authorities after arrest, court told

image.altText: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol walking through members of the press

props.synopsis: Yoon Suk Yeol faces several criminal charges related to his call to impose martial law and other criminal cases related to his time in office.

title.children: Prosecutors seek death penalty for ex-South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol

image.altText: Eagle Rock and Curracurrong Falls in the Royal national park, New South Wales.

props.synopsis: A magistrate tells a 48-year-old bus driver prison is his "only possible sentence" after he lit two small fires near Sydney in December.

title.children: 'Camper' who deliberately lit Royal National Park fires likely to be jailed

image.altText: Broken Glass Door

props.synopsis: After finding his shopfront smashed, Shane Martin checked his CCTV to find that a feral goat was the culprit.

title.children: Goat's headbutt frenzy causes thousands of dollars in damage

image.altText: Alpine F1 driver Jack Doohan unzips his race suit.

props.synopsis: Alpine and Australian Jack Doohan agree to part ways so the 22-year-old driver can "pursue other career opportunities".

title.children: Australian driver released by battling F1 team in 'mutual decision'

image.altText: A blonde woman in glasses and a light blazer stands in front of an Australian flag in a room.

props.synopsis: After weeks criticising the Albanese government over the Bondi attack and issues around antisemitism, the Coalition is split over whether proposed solutions are at odds with its interests in preserving freedom of speech.

title.children: Liberals divided over Labor's plan to outlaw inciting racial hatred

image.altText: Two firefighers attend the scene of a huge fire at a business, surrounded by debris.

props.synopsis: Four people have been killed in the latest strikes by Russia that have mainly targeted the power grid.

title.children: Ukraine hit by almost 300 drones, Volodymyr Zelenskyy says

image.altText: A man and woman, AI generated, in a store with the words 'Isla & James Bondi Beach'

props.synopsis: An online fashion retailer accused of "unconscionable conduct" has been investigated for profiting off the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Online retailer accused of trying to profit from Bondi massacre

image.altText: SailGP boats practising off the WA coast near Fremantle.

props.synopsis: The eyes of the sailing world will be on Perth's port city of Fremantle this weekend as it welcomes the high-speed, big money international Sail Grand Prix for the first time.

title.children: F1 on water comes to Fremantle as SailGP season kicks off in WA
